Class BaseAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaGOAP.GoapAction
      • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.BaseAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GroupableAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbilityActionGeneralSuperclass, AttackActionGeneralSuperclass, AttackUnitActionTerran_SiegeTank_Bombard, FollowAction, GroupingAtPositionAction, RetreatActionGeneralSuperclass, ScoutBaseLocationAction, TerranMedic_MoveBackToBase, TerranSiegeTank_SiegeMode_Reposition, TerranSiegeTank_SiegeMode_WaitForExpectedEnemy, TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoExpectedSiegeRange, TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_MoveIntoSiegeRange, TerranSiegeTank_TankMode_PrepareBombard, TerranVulture_SpiderMines_RepositionEnemy, WorkerAction

    public abstract class BaseAction
extends javaGOAP.GoapAction
implements GroupableAction
    BaseAction.java --- Superclass for all PlayerUnit actions.
    Author:
    P H - 09.02.2017

    • Method Detail

      • performAction

        protected boolean performAction(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit)
        Specified by:
        performAction in class javaGOAP.GoapAction

      • performGroupedAction

        private boolean performGroupedAction(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit)
        Extracted function for performing an action as a group and not alone. The Unit that performs the action is either just a simple member of the group or the leader of one. The former returns always true, since the targets and other important information are processed by the leader, which the latter returns the actual result of the action. This is either true, if the action was successfully performed in a group or false, if something went wrong.
        Parameters:
        goapUnit - the performing Unit.
        Returns:
        true or false depending if the Unit was a member (Always true) or the leader (True if action succeeded, false if something went wrong).

      • performSpecificAction

        protected abstract boolean performSpecificAction(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit)
        The actual performance of the action.
        Parameters:
        goapUnit - the executing Unit.
        Returns:
        true if the action was successful, false if it failed.

      • resetStoredAction

        protected void resetStoredAction()
        Function used for resetting the entry in the currentlyExecutingActions HashMap. This function has to be called when the GoapAction finishes so that the actionTrigger is going to be enabled in the next iteration.

      • getPlayerUnitsInIncreasingRange

        public static java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> getPlayerUnitsInIncreasingRange(PlayerUnit playerUnit,
                                                                            BaseAction.PlayerUnitSearchCondition condition)
        Convenience function.

        condition - the applying condition which each Unit has to fulfill.
        Returns:

      • getPlayerUnitsInIncreasingRange

        public static java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> getPlayerUnitsInIncreasingRange(PlayerUnit playerUnit,
                                                                            double minDistance,
                                                                            double stepDistance,
                                                                            BaseAction.PlayerUnitSearchCondition condition)
        Function for retrieving all Units in an increasing range around the given PlayerUnit. The range at which the Units are searched for increases stepwise until Units are found or the preset maximum is reached. This function runs until either Units are found or the maximum expand multiplier is reached. It also returns only Units that have a minimum distance towards the given PlayerUnit.
        Parameters:
        playerUnit - the PlayerUnit that the search is based around.
        minDistance - the minimum distance a Unit has to be away from the PlayerUnit for it to count.
        stepDistance - the step distance at which Units are being searched for.
        Returns:
        a HashSet containing all Units in a range around the given PlayerUnit with at least minimum distance to it.

      • getUnitWithGreatestTileStrengths

        public static bwapi.Unit getUnitWithGreatestTileStrengths(java.util.HashSet<bwapi.Unit> units,

        Function for retrieving the Unit with the greatest sum of strengths around the units TilePosition.
        Parameters:
        units - a HashSet containing all units which are going to be cycled through.
        goapUnit - the currently executing IGoapUnit.
        Returns:
        the Unit with the greatest sum of strengths at its TilePosition.

      • performSmartlyMovingToRegion

        protected boolean performSmartlyMovingToRegion(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit,
                                               BaseAction.SmartlyMovingActionWrapper actionWrapper)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Function for performing the action smartly, whereas smartly means moving from ChokePoint to ChokePoint towards the target. This is due to the Units sometimes getting stuck in Regions with either blocking minerals or neutral structures. Therefore moving between ChokePoints is advised since the used access order (= breadth-search) includes these. ChokePoints are traversed until either the target Region matches the current one of the Unit or the Unit has reached the last ChokePoint between its former Region and the target one. Nonetheless the wrapped action is performed when either one of those states apply.
        Parameters:
        goapUnit - the executing Unit.
        actionWrapper - the SmartlyMovingActionWrapper instance that contains converter functionalities as well as the concrete action that the Unit must take.
        Returns:
        true if the action was performed successfully, which means either moving between ChokePoints or executing the actual action.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - a Exception is thrown (Usually NullPointerException) when a Region can not be found via BWTA and therefore no region access order is available.

      • initSmartlyMoving

        private boolean initSmartlyMoving(SmartlyMovingPerformer performer,
                                  bwapi.Unit unit,
                                  bwapi.Position currentPosition,
                                  bwapi.Position targetPosition,
                                  MapInformation mapInformation)
        Function for initializing the provided SmartlyMovingPerformer instance. This includes:
        • Sending the (queued) move commands
        • Setting the last ChokePoint the performer must reach
        • Setting the flag signaling the Unit has reached the last ChokePoint to true if the target and current Region match
        Parameters:
        performer - the SmartlyMovingPerformer instance that is going to be initialized.
        unit - the underlying Unit which receives the move commands.
        currentPosition - the current Position of the executing / performing Unit.
        targetPosition - the Position of the action's target. Needed for extracting the traversed ChokePoints.
        mapInformation - the MapInformation instance that contains all Regions and their (reversed) region-access-orders.
        Returns:
        true if the initialization succeeded, otherwise false.

      • extractChokePointsToMoveThrough

        private java.util.List<bwta.Chokepoint> extractChokePointsToMoveThrough(MapInformation mapInformation,
                                                                        bwta.Region currentRegion,
                                                                        bwta.Region targetRegion)
        Function for extracting the List of ChokePoints that lie between two provided Region instances. The returned List starts with the ChokePoints directly at the provided, current Region and then continuous until the target Region is reached.
        Parameters:
        mapInformation - the MapInformation instance that holds the (reversed) region-access-order.
        currentRegion - the starting Region from which the search is being started.
        targetRegion - the target Region which the ChokePoints must lead to.
        Returns:
        a List containing all ChokePoints from the provided, current Region to the target one.

      • extractRegionsToMoveThrough

        private java.util.List<bwta.Region> extractRegionsToMoveThrough(MapInformation mapInformation,
                                                                bwta.Region currentRegion,
                                                                bwta.Region targetRegion)
        Function for extracting all Regions a Unit would have to move through in order to reach a specific Region. This function includes the starting and end-Region to the returned List!
        Parameters:
        mapInformation - the MapInformation instance that holds the (reversed) region-access-order.
        currentRegion - the starting Region, which is also added towards the returned List.
        targetRegion - the target Region, which is also added towards the returned List.
        Returns:
        a List containing all Regions a Unit would have to move through in order to reach the target Region.

      • issueMoveCommandsThroughChokePoints

        private boolean issueMoveCommandsThroughChokePoints(bwapi.Unit unit,
                                                    java.util.List<bwta.Chokepoint> chokePoints)
        Function for issuing the "Move" command for a Unit based upon a List of ChokePoints. The Unit is ordered to move from ChokePoint to ChokePoint. The first command is not shift-queued while the other ones are.
        Parameters:
        unit - the Unit that is going to be ordered to move.
        chokePoints - the List of ChokePoints the Unit has to move between. The first one is issued directly while the other ones are shift-queued.
        Returns:
        true if the move commands are executed successfully, otherwise false.

      • extractFarthestRegion

        public static DistantRegion extractFarthestRegion(java.util.HashSet<DistantRegion> regionDistances)
        Function for extracting the farthest Region instance from a HashSet of given DistantRegions.
        Parameters:
        regionDistances - the DistantRegion instances from which the farthest one is being extracted.
        Returns:
        the farthest Region from the provided HashSet of DistantRegions.

      • extractNextRegionTowardsTargetRegion

        public static bwta.Region extractNextRegionTowardsTargetRegion(java.util.HashMap<bwta.Region,bwta.Region> reversedRegionAccessOrder,
                                                               bwta.Region targetRegion,
                                                               bwta.Region baseRegion)
        Function for extracting the Region that leads towards a provided target Region based on a starting Region. The algorithm works as follows:
        1. Since the reversed access order is used, each key only returns a single Region
        2. All Regions stored in the HashMap eventually lead towards the base Region
        3. Therefore following the target one back towards the base Region yields the next one that a possible Unit has to move to in order to get closer to the target Region
        Parameters:
        reversedRegionAccessOrder - the reversed Region access order which is based on the provided base Region.
        targetRegion - the target Region which the returned one must eventually lead to.
        baseRegion - the base Region on which the reversed Region access order is based upon. The Region returned is one accessible by this one.
        Returns:
        the next Region accessible by the provided base one that leads towards the target Region.

      • extractSharedChokePoint

        public static bwta.Chokepoint extractSharedChokePoint(bwta.Region regionOne,
                                                      bwta.Region regionTwo)
        Function for extracting the ChokePoint between two Regions.
        Parameters:
        regionOne - the first Region.
        regionTwo - the second Region.
        Returns:
        the ChokePoint between (= shared) the provided Regions or null, if the Regions do not share one.

      • removeGroupAssociations

        public static void removeGroupAssociations(javaGOAP.IGoapUnit goapUnit)
        Function for removing any associated groupings regarding a single IGoapUnit. This is necessary since the actions can / must not detect themselves if the Unit exists / is alive.
        Parameters:
        goapUnit - the Unit whose groupings are being removed.
